title: RIP Tanks (5.5-5.16)
body:
They did it. They actually did it. The 5.16 notes have come out, it's official. Tanks are now 100% dead. 

http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/patch/patch-516-notes

Literally every single bit of discussion on Reddit, ask.fm, the Boards, PBE, or wherever else has been COMPLETELY ignored by Rito. What's the point of RiotRepertoir responding to things if nothing actually changes? Oh, the {{champion:86}} are less shitty (but still shitty). {{champion:82}} is still ruined. 

{{item:3075}} , one of the LEAST popular armor items IN THE GAME who's stats haven't been touched since 2010/2009 has finally been nerfed to a point where it's no longer good at the job it's INTENDED TO DO. Great, it does more damage against 80 AD mage auto attacks but less damage against 400+ damage crits and empowered autos. Fucking great. {{item:3110}} is finally back to season 2/3 levels of bad and {{item:3143}} is just bad, except against maybe a {{champion:157}} or {{champion:22}} but even then your {{item:3075}} returns less damage so who cares. 

Hasn't Rito learned that double nerfing fucks their game? This isn't the first time. This is like a quadruple nerf. 

(nerf armor items stats/effectiveness) \* (buff AD champions "juggernauts") \* (introduce new AD Bruiser items) \* (increase the price of armor items)

I can't wait to watch those pro flashy LC$BIGPLAY$" games where players spend 80% of the game dancing around and NOT initiating fights and everyone gets popped / killed in split seconds and tower dives are even less punished. I can't wait to see {{champion:64}} in every game AGAIN.  I can't wait to see increased strategic diversity by seeing an entire role/class of champions essentially disappear from games. Oh wait. 

Fucking useless Rito balance team.

replies.body: It's a mixed bag in my eyes.  {{item:3075}} and {{item:3110}} are clearly now either just straight up bad or only worthwhile on a very short list of champions.  {{item:3143}} is still going to be good, especially with that active buff and the increased resistance to crits.  Most the other changes to tank items are more or less neutral in my opinion.  It's only Frozen Heart and Thornmail that are outright being ruined, but those are not necessary items for most tanks.  Also Titanic Hydra and Sterak's Gage are pretty significant additions to tank options allowing for tanks to add damage and/or survivability on top of their basic tankiness.  Titanic Hydra in particular, functioning as a single damage item, is going to be huge for a lot of tanks.  Also let's not forget the MR buffs and the many armor items that are going unchanged.  I do think the Cinderhulk changes are a pretty big hit to tank junglers, making it more of a bruiser jungle item since it's better on its own while granting less power when building really tanky.  Overall I think these changes are pretty questionable, but I don't think tanks are dead.

So on the Frozen Heart and Thornmail changes, two points. We're watching these closely, and will adjust as needed. Two, these items made it very hard to build other items that had armor on them without completely removing AD threats from the game. Frozen Heart was especially crazy in terms of the stats per gold spent. 

That meant that if we ever wanted to add an item that could compete, we had to either doom them to tier two if we made them reasonable, or add another item that gave out waaay too much for the gold spent. If we make items that compete with the top tiers of efficiency, we simply create the new must buy build, rather than inject any sort of decision making. 

We want items to provide power more contextually, rather than just give out a lot of stats. This allows the same item to be stronger and weaker from game to game, based on comps, who is strong, and how you want to play. 

That being said, we did hit a lot of tank core items in this patch, and we will be watching if the other compensation buffs (MR buffs and some armor base stat buffs) keep these guys afloat. Totally get that these changes are a lot to cope with in a block like this.

I think something to make up for Frozen Heart at least is, maybe you could change the Attack Speed slow aura back to the 20% it used to have? Not only would it strengthen its niche, but we lost yet another attack speed slow due to the Darius rework so making the only item that gives this utility better at doing that would help out.

As for Thornmail... I honestly don't know as I'm not sure about how the math works out with the scaling off your bonus armor. Best I can think of is to give it some other stat besides just armor to make it have a general purpose niche of some kind (Like how Frozen Heart gives mana) of which the only defensive stat I can think of that isn't given by an armor item (Except through a unique passive) is movespeed but I don't know if it would make sense to put movespeed on it.

So if we need to buff these items, you are correct that we'd look first at the unique effects the items have. Definitely the only option, but we want to make sure items have more power tied up in the things that are special to them.

I think a lot of us are concerned that if these items have been over-nerfed you won't do anything about it for quite some time, if ever.  I mean look at Essence Reaver, Runaan's Hurricane, Guinsoo's Rageblade, etc.  These items have been in a bad state for a long time, and you guys never buff them or only buff them very slightly (Runaan's Hurricane).
Runaan's is at least usable on some champions. {{champion:10}} {{champion:17}} {{champion:110}} {{champion:29}}
You forgot Runaan's true master... {{champion:429}}
i normally hate when people complain about {{champion:429}} but that genuinely made me laugh out loud _**1+**_

> [{quoted}](name=Fearless,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=o9z6EaKQ,comment-id=0004000100000000,timestamp=2015-08-20T00:34:16.247+0000)
>
> So if we need to buff these items, you are correct that we'd look first at the unique effects the items have. Definitely the only option, but we want to make sure items have more power tied up in the things that are special to them.

The one "unique" thing about {{item:3075}} got nerfed. It's supposed to be the anti-basic attack item. Now it returns half as much of the damage dealt by AD. What, is it now a hybrid "sort-of anti-basic attack, sort-of armor stacking" item??

{{item:3143}} had a unique identity. It was the anti-kiting item. It used to give a 10% movement speed debuff on-hit. It reduced kiting potential that ranged champions had and allowed for easier gap closing. Now, it no longer gives the 10% movement speed debuff (yes I was super salty last year when you guys removed it) and now is an anti-crit item? Wasn't {{item:3075}} supposed to be the anti-crit item? So which is it? Is {{item:3143}} built against crit or attack speed? Or is it just built no matter what because it's a ball of stats that just gives 60 armor/400 HP now? Where's the uniqueness? The new {{item:3143}} overlaps MORE with the new {{item:3075}} than previously.

{{item:3110}} was a straight up nerf. Did we forget the days of season 2/3 when nobody bought this item? The stats weren't too different from before. Also, was the item gold efficient? Sure. If you ignore its mana stat (which is a deceptively useless stat if you think about it), it's not THAT gold efficient. Also, why was increasing the price not an options? Why ALSO reduce 10 armor? {{item:3110}} is the anti-attack speed item yet why does it have the same amount of attack-speed debuff as {{item:3143}} ? Doesn't feel that unique. "Oh it has an aura". Yes, an aura that is 700 range. The attack speed reduction itself (to the user) feels the exact same as the one from {{item:3143}}.

How about this: Keep the 90 armor on {{item:3110}} but I want to see at least a 30% or 35% attack-speed debuff. On that note, {{item:3143}} should have no attack speed debuff and double down by giving 25% crit reduction. Aren't all these changes about being unique? Do you see the hypocrisy of this?

I agree..many 'fixes' here were completely unwarranted other than to make sure people's heads explode for LCS.  Fearless....the reason SC2 basically died as an e-sport was because of the terrible terrible damage.  It leaves out any room for real strategy when an army/teams explode in just a few seconds off one engagement.  Tanks are what create the different strategic and tactical variety on the battlefield.  Without them the meta game will be so stale many will lose interest.

What if armor as a whole turns out to be too weak? (Doesn't require much intelligence to realize it will) Can you atleast give back 5 armor to the nerfed ones? Why make a new item and instantly nerf it? "Oh the new item can't compare to the current ones, elt's nerf them too!"

> [{quoted}](name=Fearless,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=o9z6EaKQ,comment-id=0004000100000000,timestamp=2015-08-20T00:34:16.247+0000)
>
> So if we need to buff these items, you are correct that we'd look first at the unique effects the items have. Definitely the only option, but we want to make sure items have more power tied up in the things that are special to them.

I think you need to make the unique aspects of the items more appealing, and really look at what they will be against, more than just make them "special".

For example, Randuins will without a doubt become the new go to over frozen heart because of the crit mitigation, because Crit is an easy to obtain and must buy for Marksman right now. Any mitigation to Crit will be highly prized, so basically you guys just went full circle from making Randuins the most bought, to Frozen heart, then back to Randuins again.

Unique doesn't always mean good, like with Essence Reaver vs Bloodthirster. Sure Essence Reaver is "unique" but not really unique enough. The special ability isn't that great against anything is the problem, whereas Bloodthirster has more lifesteal which is the real thing people want, plus that shield.

I think there needs to be less of a focus on "unique" and more of a focus on useful vs X and Y, like Randuins is now. It may take a couple of days, but I can promise you pros are going to rush for Randuins just like they used to before the nerfs to it and buffs to Frozen Heart. 

In reality these changes have made unique items, but just lowered the real choices, because the unique aspects (10% crit mitigation is a big deal right now) honestly take the choice out of the choice.

You have to now be even more careful how you balance, because if you say, lower that to 7% crit mitigation, or 5%, since you guys like to buff and nerf in percentages of 5, then what is the point of the unique aspect, and no one will get it and just spam frozen heart.

tl;dr

You have "balanced" your way into a very awkward corner when you look at the entire picture.

My biggest problem is Thornmail. I don't play tanks that much, but when I do I snag Thornmail asap if I see they have a lot of auto-attack reliant champions. I feel like these changes have very much muddled the cases for when you'd want to buy it, and will probably result in fewer purchases.

Why is it whenever tank items are brought up it's like a spin-the-wheel on what bullshit Riot will say next that mysteriously doesn't apply to other classes?

This time it's item space! Yes, only tanks need to worry about item space.

Why not nerf BT? If you ever wanted to add another lifesteal item it'd be hard because of how powerful BT is. Why not nerf IE? It's impossible to make a better crit item than IE. Why not nerf LW/VS? Can't make a penetration item that competes with them, since they'll always be more cost efficiency than Jesus Christ himself. But oh lawdy Frozen Heart is doing what FH has literally always done since it was released, what a design cramper!

Tanks have, UNDENIABLY, the highest diversity in item builds in any class. Yet every single time Riot comes around drunkenly slamming their items it's always item diversity. All the way back to Season 2 when Atma's was nerfed because it was cramping item diversity. Yet APs still have to build the same 3 items every game, and ADCs have exactly 1 item that they can swap out.

Also there's a lot more good damage-item options than good defense-item options. Look how many AP items there are, compare with how many good MR items there are. AD vs armor. %Penetration vs ???

Way more multipliers on the offense-side than the defense side.

damage/dps is a function of (AD or AP) \* (crit chance) \* (crit damage) \*  (CDR) \* (Attack Speed) \* (Penetration) \* (Ability Ratios) \* (Whatever offensive steroids in kit and masteries)

survivability is a function of (MR or Armor) \* HP \* (Attack-Speed Debuffs) \* (Crit Damage reduction) \* (whatever defense steroids in kit and masteries)

Yeah, but there's this thing called trade-offs that exist. If you invest two inventory slots into {{item:3110}} {{item:3075}} you get no HP or MR and that means you melt to magic damage. 

That's like saying {{item:3031}}  and {{item:3046}} make it very hard to build other items that had dps on them without completely removing ANY threats from the game. 

Also, the CLG game last weekend where {{champion:98}} had 4 armor items ({{item:3047}} {{item:3068}} {{item:3143}} {{item:3075}} ) and yet couldn't nullify Doublelift's {{champion:18}} as a threat from the game (and in fact melted to her all the same) completely invalidates this point.

If we make items that compete with the top tiers of efficiency, we simply create the new must buy build, rather than inject any sort of decision making.

Are you saying if you wanted to introduce newer armor items they wouldn't be able to compete with {{item:3110}} and {{item:3075}}? If so, fair enough that makes sense. So why not just leave their stats the exact same and increase their cost? Wouldn't this be the easiest and best way to fix this problem?
 
> 
> We want items to provide power more contextually, rather than just give out a lot of stats. This allows the same item to be stronger and weaker from game to game, based on comps, who is strong, and how you want to play. 

You claim that, and yet you allow damage items ({{item:3031}} {{item:3046}} {{item:3035}} ) to remain universally good for most ADCs in most situations. There isn't some games where like say an ADC would say "actually I don't think I want to buy {{item:3035}})." ADCs don't suddenly stop building damage because of what an enemy champion might happen to build. A tank wants to stack as much survivability as possible just like an ADC wants to stack as much damage as possible. This is a simple concept. 

This isn't giving more diversity. A tank is still going to stack ALL of the items (if possible). It's not a matter of "here, you have more strategic options" but more like "I don't want you to be as effective anymore."

> 
> That being said, we did hit a lot of tank core items in this patch, and we will be watching if the other compensation buffs (MR buffs and some armor base stat buffs) keep these guys afloat. Totally get that these changes are a lot to cope with in a block like this.

The primary frustrating thing is that this has happened before. In a small window of time, tanks are given viability with some changes in items and then a few patch later are nerfed back into irrelevance. Meanwhile ADCs are in every game will always be viable and are always strong.  It's a never-ending cycle of disappointment. Count how many tanks are ACTUALLY being played in the average pro game or average non-pro game. Seriously, count it. The tank meta was problematic back in 5.5 when Cinderhulk first came out and there were like 4-tank team comps. What about now? How are they seriously problematic now?

What is frozen heart's new niche anyway?  Randuin's old niche was 'generic tanky item' and was switched to 'anti-crit specialist' right?  But it still negates the advantages of ADCs attack speed doesn't it?  it still feels like frozen heart is outclassed by randuin's just because you can pick up a randuin's which gives both health and armor.  More importantly thornmail gives more raw protection.  The only niche that I see frozen heart fitting is generic anti AD champions which means that it is going to be worse.  maybe not significantly worse depending on the situation, but worse nonetheless.

if you had paid a little attention to this game at all over the past years you´d know that tanks donßt scale into the lategame at all already and it´s by no means justifyable to nerf their fullbuild further. If you think tankitems are too gold efficient - alright (though as they usually have to itemize against ad and ap the same time they really need to be somewhat deficient to keep up), but you hvae to make up for that with offering real lategame scaling/slot efficient tankitems finally.

but we already know you don´t care, you just want the assassin vs ad, zed 100%pick/ban meta back for worlds.

I'm sorry but I never saw those items ever "remove AD threats from the game".  I have literally no idea what you are referring to there.  AD champs have Last Whisper, Black Cleaver, and Blade of the Ruined King to deal with tanks, along with many champs have specific anti-tank abilities.  Besides, stacking lots of armor makes you very vulnerable to AP damage (and shouldn't all AD teams be punished for bad team comp selection?).  I just don't get the reasoning you are using here.
